api.name: diretto Feed API
api.author: Benjamin Erb
api.description: The Feed API provides non-JSON lists of entries in popular feed formats. It can be used for retrieving lists of available documents and attachments. Some of the feeds are PubSubHubbub-enabled, which allows clients to register for notifications upon new items. See also the Streaming API and the list resources of the Core API as alternatives.

resource.name: Index
resource.description: This entry resource provides information about the instance.

operation.name: Get service instance data
operation.description: Returns a static information about the deployed Feed API service instance.

responses.answer: Service instance data in response entity

entity.description: The JSON response contains information about the service identification and version, the actual deployment variables and links to the main service instance.

resource.name: Atom Feeds
resource.description: The following sub-resources provide feeds of entries added to the platform as Atom feeds. Feeds are paginated as described in RFC 5005.

operation.name: List of published documents
operation.description: An Atom feed of documents added to the platform, sorted by publish time. This feed is PubSubHubbub-enabled.

resource.description: The following sub-resources provide feeds of entries added to the platform as spatial KML feeds.

operation.name: List of document positions within a given bounding box
operation.description: A KML feed of all document positions that are inside the given bounding box. The maximum size of the response is limited. If the number of hits in the requested area exceeds a limit, the request will be denied and should be returned using a smaller bounding box. If a document has multiple suggested positions, the best ranked will be chosen.

responses.answer: Too much hits, decrease bounding box size and retry
